page.title: 01SUMMARY-Seaward end of C.M.
page.content: The village of Combe Martin lies five miles to the east of Ilfracombe and ten miles from Barnstaple. The area includes many beaches some of which are only reached by steep paths. The two main beaches, Harbour beach and Newberry beach, become one at low tide which exposes a large expanse of sand with safe sea bathing. The rock pools and streams afford children many hours of enjoyment. The main attractions are the peace and quiet and the scenic beauty. For the visitors there are many types of accomodation, restaurants, cafes and shops of all kinds. There is car parking for about 200 cars. The village primary school is in this area together with many attractive bungalows as this is also a favourite retirement area.
